intro: Mentha × sativa var. subrotundifolia, commonly known as round-leaf mint, is a hybrid mint species characterized by its rounded, oval-shaped leaves. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and potential medicinal properties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and a dense, bushy habit. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent. The plant prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for both garden cultivation and herbal use.
